data.title: Dinner near Cambria hotel
data.text: Friday's was within walking distance from the Cambria Hotel.  Good was very good.  We did have to wait for seating (Saturday night).  Service was a little slow by our primary waiter but other waiter helped out.

data.title: Average food & slow service
data.text:
We've been to TGI Fridays several times since they've opened.  The waitstaff is consistently upbeat & pleasant - but very slow to deliver food and the final check.  The food was quite good on the first trips - well seasoned fries, juicy burgers, etc- my son loves their boneless wings in Memphis BBQ sauce.  Since then on our most recent visit, we would have been better off going to 5-Guys (just next door)!  The waiter came by to say that our food would be out momentarily & then disappeared.  Since I had a direct view of the kitchen, I could see that our burgers were out & under the heat light.  10 min later when I was ready to stand up & get them myself, someone delivered.  Both my husband & I asked for the specialty sauces on the side - neither was there- the fries had no seasoning & tasted like frozen ones warmed up in the microwave.  Luckily the manager came by & after assuring us that their fries were exactly the same as when they opened, did have fresh fries made up & brought over.  The waiter did bring one of the sauces but said that they had run out of the other.  It was another long wait to flag someone down to get the check & then take payment.
Each time we've visited - there is a tremendously long wait to first get the check, run the credit card through & return it to your table.

data.title: The Worst Friday's I have ever been to
data.text: The service was awful.  The meal was wrong and the manager came over to handle it.  When the waiter brought me a new meal he said they took off my soda.. I mean really the soda?  I ordered a steak meal.   I went back during a 2nd business trip around 12:30am/1am They said only the bar is open I said your website says otherwise.  No where on the site does it state this it says open till 2am  I will not be going back here anymore; there are plenty of other restaurants in the area.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We haven't eaten at a TGIFriday's in awhile, so it was a real treat for us to pull off the highway from Boston to Hershey and have a quick lunch here today.  I had the strawberry fields salad, my daughter had the chicken fingers and we shared a loaded potato skins appetizer.  All was very delicious, as usual, and our waitress was a real delight!

data.title: AVOID!
data.text: We have tried twice, unsuccessfully, to eat here.  The first time, although there were numerous tables available, we were told there would be a "solid 20 minute wait."  We left.  The next time, again the restaurant was empty, we were state, and then ignored for 20 minutes.  No one even brought us water.  Again, we left.  Don't bother with this place.

data.title: Not BAD
data.text: Love that they have happy hour all day and you dont have to rush to beat the 7pm time limits.  We had the Jack Daniel Rib Eye and it was cooked just right.  We enjoyed the free chips a salsa.  The Manger did come around greeting the tables.  The bar area is really nice with booths included.

data.title: very good
data.text: We went to TGI Friday's for lunch.  It was early so it wasn't very crowded.  The waiter was fabulous and the food was good.  I must say the bathrooms were very clean. The decor was pleasant.

data.title: Typical Fridays
data.text: Place was fine. Staff were friendly and attentive. Place was packed, but not too loud. Boyfriend appreciated all the TVs.

data.title: Omg
data.text: Went to the TGI Friday's in white plains and it was just bad.  We got seated right away but it took our server for ever to get to us.  When she finally came she was not too knowledgeable about the menu for some simple questions.  The drinks we ordered took a while to get to us and the entre was serves and we had nothing to eat with.  The server was very nice despite it all which made it easy on us.  The food was good , typical for chain restaurant food.

data.title: plan on waiting for a seat, a menu, a smile, and if you last that long, your food.
data.text: The wait staff stand around in a huddle while the hungry diners stand in the doorway waiting for a seat. even when the restaurant is empty, they make you wait forever. No smiles, not welcome, no hospitality at all. I have tried to eat there several times-once I actually got in and out in under an hour. the other two times, I didn't even get seated in 15 minutes and wound up walking to Panera's instead.

data.title: Great food, friendly staff.
data.text: We were staying just around the corner and on two nights we braved the rain and ate in Fridays. Very nice food and despite being very busy, we were served quickly and by very pleasant staff.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: This is now our third trip to this particular Friday's in the past 2 months hoping the service would improve.  Every time we have come regardless of how busy the restaurant has been the service ha been slow and just plain bad.   Today was the last straw our entree was brought out wrong and was sent back only to return a half hour later again wrong.  The receipt showed the order in properly and it came out not even close to correct.  We will never be returning.

data.title: Waitress very rude, but reasonable food.
data.text: Food was fine but the waitress was rude when we asked to split the check. Finally got the check split and then found out the gift card we wanted to use had a zero balance which was not correct. Brought the matter to the attention of the manager who apologized. The waitress then slammed the corrected bill on the table. A pleasant dinner was topped off by rude behavior and possibly cheated on the gift card.

data.title: Exactly What You Would Expect From A Chain Restaurant
data.text:
Upon our arrival we were greeted after a brief wait, Seated where we were seated where we asked to be seated and were told our servers name than we were left alone. After more then 8mins of sitting with no one looking in on us, we moved ourselves to the bar, hoping for better service. The bar had only one couple sitting at it. We positioned ourselves directly across from them. While the bartender was present, she was not attentive. She was busy cutting fruit and talking to co-workers, as I recall.  After a 'too long of a wait', (we had been in the building more than 15minutes by this point) we finally got her attention and ordered beers. The Glasses were chilled nicely and the beers were cold. On closer inspection my friend's beer I noted a 'floaty bit' in it, we brought it to the attention of the bartender and it was replaced without issue, apology or smile.  When the bartender returned with the fresh beer, I asked "you seem like you are having a hard day, are you?" Her reply made me laugh out loud. She said "Yes, I am so busy" to which I laughed and stood on my stool and looked around the bar and restaurant. I saw two other patrons at the bar and a hand full of tables had a few couples at them. I saw no reason to reply to her complaint 

We were at the bar for about 3hrs, each time we wanted to get a beer or an appetizer; it was a struggle to get the bartenders attention. At one point I waved my hands in the air for more then 30sconds, to which she took no notice, though many others did. There was no customer service from her or interaction of a convivial nature. I will mention here that all the servers that brought us the apps we ordered where pleasant and sociable. In fact the server who was suppose to be our table server, when bring us an app, introduced herself and apologies for the delay earlier in a very nice way. 

In sum - 
The prices were good.
The beers were cold.
The bar staff & hostess staff; inattentive and too often absent.

It is unlikely that I will be returning to TGI Fridays in the foreseeable future.

data.title: No service
data.text: Went with my wife on 10/23/15 for an early dinner before shopping. Was seated immediately by the hostess. Sat for 10 minutes at the table with our menus and was never approached by a waiter or waitress. Walked out very unhappy. If I ever go back it will be to sit at the bar where maybe I'll be able to get some service.

data.title: So so...
data.text:
We took on Sunday evening. So very busy.
We waited in 30 mins.
Foods were so so. Hamburger was nice tastes. Just may be I went to 4stars restaurant a couple of days before.
The clarks were good but busy.

data.title: happy hour
data.text: We here for lunch and found out that they have happy hour all day long but different drinks are offered every day of the week.  Our bartender Sebastian was really cool and funny which made the experience even better.  I would recommend this place, especially the new updated, modern décor makes you feel like you are dining in a high end place.

data.title: Bad food combined with employee indifference
data.text: Ordered flat iron steak medium rare. Got a pasty brown steak with no sear. Ate around the edges, then sent back the raw center (70% of the steak) to be warmed up. Got back steaming hot piece of garbage straight from the microwave. I'll put as much effort into this review as employees did in providing a decent dining experience...none.

data.title: nice happy hour - extended hours
data.text: Sit at the bar, have the drink special of the day (weekdays), enjoy discounted appetizers - everything is delicious!

data.title: Largest place I've ever seen
data.text: Great food but be careful. As we were waiting to be seated a young lady sat beside me very close. Later I realized my credit cards were missing from that pocket. Very quick, very smooth.
